column2: NE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: NE

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. It is against the law to:
column4: go around lowered railroad gates at a crossing.
column6: pass a school bus with flashing red lights and the stop sign arm extended.
column8: pass within 100 feet of a railroad crossing.

column2: 2. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 3. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 4. Drivers convicted of fleeing in order to avoid arrest for the violation of any Nebraska law can have their license revoked.
column6: True

column2: 5. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 7. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 8. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
column6: True

column2: 9. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 10. BAC is:
column6: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 11. When driving on the interstate, drivers should use the left lane:
column6: to enter the exit ramp.
column8: when driving faster than the speed limit.

column2: 12. When entering an interstate highway, you should check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed toÂ match the flow of traffic, signal and:
column6: wait for the lane to be clear.
column8: merge into that gap when safe.

column2: 13. The following is true regarding air bags:
column4: the driver of a vehicle equipped with air bags should not wear a safety belt.
column6: children age 6 and under should always sit in the front seat of a car that is equipped with air bags.
column8: when combined with seat belts, air bags provide improved crash protection.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Pass only in the right lane
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 15. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is a warning sign.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 16. BAC is expressed in:
column6: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on rural roadways is:
column6: 35 MPH
column8: 40 MPH

column2: 18. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: to signal all lane changes.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: Keep left
column8: Winding road

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 23. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 24. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: get back into the vehicle.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
